function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Poor indoor air quality (IAQ) due to the presence of gases (CO2, VOCs, SO2, NOx, CO, PM, and ozone) in different indoor settings.","Impact":"Increased risk of respiratory problems, allergic reactions, and other health issues for occupants.","Mitigation":"Regular ventilation, air purifiers, and proper maintenance of ventilation systems to improve IAQ.","Technologies":"Air quality sensors, air purifiers, and smart ventilation systems for monitoring and improving IAQ.","People":"Building occupants, especially those with respiratory conditions or allergies.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, and environmental health specialists."},{"Description":"High power consumption of gas sensors used for IAQ monitoring.","Impact":"Increased operational costs and energy consumption in buildings with IAQ monitoring systems.","Mitigation":"Use of low-power gas sensors, energy-efficient sensor nodes, and optimized sensor deployment strategies to reduce power consumption.","Technologies":"Low-power gas sensors, energy-efficient electronics, and wireless sensor networks for remote monitoring.","People":"Building owners, facility managers, and technology integrators.","Owner":"Building owners, sensor manufacturers, and technology integrators."},{"Description":"Reliability and calibration issues with environmental settings and sensor characteristics for accurate IAQ monitoring.","Impact":"Inaccurate IAQ data, leading to ineffective air quality management and potential health risks for occupants.","Mitigation":"Thorough calibration of sensors, environmental monitoring, and regular maintenance of sensor nodes to ensure accuracy.","Technologies":"Calibration equipment, environmental monitoring devices, and sensor maintenance tools for accurate IAQ monitoring.","People":"Building owners, facility managers, and environmental health specialists.","Owner":"Building owners, sensor manufacturers, and environmental health specialists."}]}
